<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A15-23428_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our foreign income is not a material component of total loss before provision for income taxes.&nbsp; We intend to reinvest the earnings of our non-U.S. subsidiary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our valuation allowance for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased by $5.4 million to $45.9 million from $40.6 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.&#160; Our valuation allowance for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased $5.5 million to $40.6 million from $35.1 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2013.&#160; We have fully reserved against our deferred tax assets based on our assessment of the future realizability of our deferred tax assets.&#160; In performing these assessments, we consider whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized.&#160; We consider all available evidence, both positive and negative, including historical levels of income, expectations and risks associated with estimates of future taxable income in assessing the need for a valuation allowance.&#160; A cumulative taxable loss in recent years makes it more difficult for us to realize our deferred tax assets.&#160; We have had three years of cumulative U.S. tax losses and cannot rely on common tax planning strategies to use U.S. tax losses and we are precluded from relying on projections of future taxable income to support the recognition of deferred tax assets.&#160; As such, the ultimate realization of our deferred tax assets is dependent upon the existence of sufficient taxable income generated in the carryforward periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we have federal and state research and development tax credit carryforwards of approximately $4.6 million and $6.0 million, respectively.&#160; The federal tax credits begin to expire in 2027.&#160; The state tax credit carryforward can be carried forward indefinitely.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our federal and state net operating loss carryforwards for income tax purposes are approximately $78.3 million and $62.0 million, respectively, which expire at various dates through 2035.&nbsp; Our federal and California NOLs have increased significantly as a result of acquired NOL carryforwards through our stock acquisition of CaseCentral Inc. in 2012.&#160; The utilization of NOL carryforwards to reduce taxable income is subject to certain statutory limitations as defined in section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Included in the NOL deferred tax asset above is approximately $4.0 million of deferred tax asset attributable to excess stock option deductions.&nbsp; Due to a provision within ASC 718,
<I>
	Compensation &#151; Stock Compensation
</I>
	, concerning when tax benefits related to excess stock option deductions can be credited to paid in capital, the related valuation allowance cannot be reversed, even if the facts and circumstances indicate that it is not more likely than not that the deferred tax asset can be realized.&nbsp; The valuation allowance will only be reversed as the related deferred tax asset is applied to reduce taxes payable.&nbsp; The Company follows
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	(ASC 740) ordering to determine when such NOL has been realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we intend to indefinitely reinvest the earnings of our foreign subsidiaries.&nbsp; Undistributed earnings in our foreign subsidiaries are not significant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We file income tax returns with the Internal Revenue Service, and the taxing authorities of various state and foreign jurisdictions.&#160; We adopted the provisions of accounting for uncertain tax positions in accordance with the
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	(ASC 740) topic on January&nbsp;1, 2007 and, accordingly, performed a comprehensive review of our uncertain tax positions as of that date.&#160; In this regard, an uncertain tax position represents our expected treatment of a tax position taken in a filed tax return, or planned to be taken in a future tax return, that has not been reflected in measuring income tax expense for financial reporting purposes.&#160; A reconciliation of our total unrecognized tax benefits at December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our unrecognized tax benefit as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 is $1.1 million.&#160; We are subject to routine corporate income tax audits in the United States and foreign jurisdictions.&#160; Due to the net operating loss carryforwards, the Company&#146;s United States federal and state returns are generally open to examination by the Internal Revenue Service and state jurisdictions when such net operating losses are utilized.&#160; Most foreign jurisdictions have statute of limitations that range from three to six years.
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Since we have fully reserved against our deferred tax assets, the liability for uncertain tax positions is merely a reduction to our deferred tax assets and related valuation allowance which is reflected in our Consolidated Balance Sheets.&#160; Any subsequent reduction of the valuation allowance and the recognition of the associated tax benefit would affect our effective tax rate.&#160; Our policy is to recognize interest and penalties related to uncertain tax positions, if any, in the income tax provision.&#160; Interest and penalties are computed based upon the difference between our uncertain tax positions under Income Taxes and the amount deducted or expected to be deducted in our tax returns. Due to the overall tax loss position of the Company, we have not accrued or paid for interest and penalties in 2015, 2014 and 2013.&#160; The Company does not expect its uncertain income tax positions to have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements within the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 8.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Debt Obligations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On August&nbsp;29, 2014, we entered into a three year, Senior Secured Revolving Line of Credit (&#147;Revolver&#148;) with a bank. The maximum principal amount that may be outstanding at any given time under the Revolver, which includes up to $3.0 million of standby letters of credit, is $10.0 million. Any borrowings under the Revolver would be secured by substantially all of our assets, as well as pledges of capital stock. The Revolver requires that, if we suffer an event of default or have borrowed more than 75% of the maximum principal amount permitted to be outstanding, we maintain an Adjusted Quick Ratio of at least 1.15 to 1.0. If the Adjusted Quick Ratio falls below 1.5 to 1.0, any collections received by the bank on behalf of the Company will be applied to outstanding loan balances before being remitted to the Company&#146;s operating account. The Adjusted Quick Ratio is calculated by dividing Quick Assets (cash less restricted cash plus accounts receivable) by current liabilities (current liabilities plus outstanding standby letter of credit less the current portion of deferred revenue). Borrowings under the Revolver bear interest at a floating rate ranging from 1.25% to 3.25% above the Prime Rate depending on the Company&#146;s Adjusted Quick Ratio. We are obligated to pay a commitment fee of $0.2 million over the three year term of the Revolver. All principal, interest and any other fees will be due and payable in full on or prior to August&nbsp;29, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we were in compliance with all the covenants of the Revolver.&nbsp; We had letters of credit outstanding against the Revolver in the amount of $1.2 million, resulting in the maximum available borrowing under the Revolver to be $8.6 million.&nbsp; Availability is calculated as 80% of eligible accounts receivable, with a maximum of $10.0 million.&nbsp; To date we have not borrowed under the Revolver.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 9.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Leases
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We lease certain facilities and equipment under non-cancellable operating leases extending through 2024.&#160; The present value of the remaining future minimum lease payments under capital leases is recorded in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&#160; The following is a schedule of future minimum lease payments under capital leases and operating leases (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Rent expense related to operating leases for 2015, 2014 and 2013 was approximately $4.3 million, $4.9 million and $6.2 million, respectively.&#160; During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we did not have sublease rental income.

<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Equity Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At our 2015 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our stockholders approved the Third Amendment (the &#147;Third Amendment&#148;) to the Guidance Software,&nbsp;Inc. Second Amended and Restated 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;).&#160; The Third Amendment increased the aggregate number of shares of our common stock available for awards under the Plan by an additional 3,000,000 shares, from approximately 800,000 shares to a total of 3,800,000 shares.&#160; The Third Amendment was approved by our Board of Directors in March&nbsp;2015.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, approximately 3,263,000 shares were available for grant as options or nonvested restricted stock awards under the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We define in-the-money options at December&nbsp;31, 2015 as options that had exercise prices that were lower than the $6.02 fair market value of our common stock at that date.&#160; The aggregate intrinsic value of options outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2015 is calculated as the difference between the exercise price of the underlying options and the fair market value of our common stock for the approximately 1,067,000 options that were in-the-money at that date, of which approximately 166,000 were exercisable.&#160; The total intrinsic value of stock options exercised, determined as of the date of exercise, was $0.6 million, $1.1 million and $1.5 million during the years 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following summarizes information about options unvested at December&nbsp;31, 2015 that, based on current forfeiture rates, are expected to ultimately vest:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted Stock Awards
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We issue restricted stock awards to certain directors, officers and employees.&#160; The terms of the awards granted under the Second Amended and Restated Plan are determined at the time of grant, and vest 25% annually over a four-year service period.&#160; A summary of restricted stock awards activity follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A15-23428_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Share-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We account for share-based compensation in accordance with
<I>
	Compensation-Stock Compensation
</I>
	(ASC 718).&#160;&#160; Compensation expense for stock options is recognized using the Black-Scholes option pricing model to determine the grant date fair value of share-based payments and recognize that cost, net of an estimated forfeiture rate, as compensation expense on a straight-line basis over the vesting period. Stock awards generally vest 25% annually over a four-year service period.&#160; The determination of the grant date fair value of share-based awards using that model is affected by our stock price as well as assumptions regarding a number of complex and subjective variables. These variables include the estimated number of years that we expect employees to hold their stock options (the option &#147;expected term&#148;) and our expected stock price volatility, risk-free interest rates and dividends to be paid on our stock over that term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The fair values of stock options granted under the Second Amended and Restated Plan were estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model and the following weighted average assumptions (no stock options were awarded in 2013):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_33"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="64%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;MARGIN-LEFT:1.25IN;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="53%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:53.58%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.88%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	When historical data is available and relevant, the expected term of options granted is determined by calculating the average term from historical stock option exercise experience.&#160; The volatility of our common stock is estimated at the date of grant based on the volatility of our publicly traded common stock over the prior 24 months.&#160; The volatility is calculated based on the adjusted close price each day from a composite index. The risk-free interest rate used in option valuation is based on the implied yield in effect at the time of each option grant, based on US Treasury zero-coupon issues with equivalent expected terms. We use a dividend yield of zero in the Black-Scholes model, as we have no expectation we will pay any cash dividends on our common stock in the foreseeable future.
<I>
	Compensation-Stock Compensation
</I>
	(ASC 718) also requires that we estimate forfeitures at the time of grant and revise those estimates in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from those estimates. We use historical data to estimate pre-vesting option forfeitures and record share-based compensation expense only for those awards that are expected to vest. Quarterly changes in the estimated forfeiture rate can potentially have a significant effect on reported share-based compensation, as the cumulative effect of adjusting the forfeiture rate for all expense amortization after the grant date is recognized in the period the forfeiture estimate is changed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following table summarizes the share-based compensation expense we recorded:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 10.1PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.1PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Stock option awards

	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was approximately $2.3 million of total unrecognized share-based compensation cost related to stock options that is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 3.5 years and approximately $11.7 million of total unrecognized share-based compensation cost related to restricted stock awards that is expected to be recognized over a weighted-

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A15-23428_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	average period of 2.6 years.&#160; We expect to record approximately $6.2 million in share-based compensation in 2016 related to options and restricted stock awards outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Defined Employee Contribution Plans
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company has a 401(k)&nbsp;plan that allows all full-time eligible employees to contribute up to 75% of their semi-monthly earnings, up to the maximum limit set by the IRS each year.&#160; We match $0.50 on each dollar up to the first 6% of the employee&#146;s eligible compensation.&#160; Additionally, the Company may make discretionary contributions to the Plan regardless of profitability.&#160; We recorded contribution related expense of approximately $1.0 million, $0.9 million and $1.1 million in the years 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 11.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Stockholders&#146; Equity
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In August&nbsp;2008, our Board of Directors authorized a program to repurchase shares of our common stock having an aggregate value of up to $8.0 million.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had approximately $3.6 million remaining under this authorization.&#160; Acquisitions of shares may be made from time-to-time at management&#146;s discretion, at prevailing prices in the open market, or in privately negotiated transactions, as permitted by securities laws and other legal requirements, and are subject to market conditions and other factors.&#160; As of January&nbsp;1, 2014, we no longer withheld common shares from employees for personal income tax purposes upon the vesting of restricted stock awards, and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 we withheld 284,000 common shares. Collectively, these shares are recorded as treasury stock, at cost, in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 12.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Fair Value Measurements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with
<I>
	Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures (ASC 820)
</I>
	for financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis.
<I>
	Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures (ASC 820)
</I>
	requires disclosure that establishes a framework for measuring fair value and expands disclosure about fair value measurements. Under this standard, fair value is defined as the price that would be received in exchange for selling an asset or paid to transfer a liability (i.e., the &#147;exit price&#148;) in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.
<I>
	Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures(ASC 820)
</I>
	establishes a hierarchy for inputs used in measuring fair value that minimizes the use of unobservable inputs by requiring the use of observable market data when available. Observable inputs are inputs that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability based on active market data. Unobservable inputs would be inputs that reflect our assumptions about the assumptions market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability based on the best information available in the circumstances. The statement requires fair value measurements be classified and disclosed in one of the following three categories:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;MARGIN-LEFT:.4IN;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:8.7%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 1:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.62%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:87.68%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets that are accessible at the measurement date for identical, unrestricted assets and liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:8.7%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 2:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.62%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:87.68%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Quoted prices in markets that are not active or financial instruments for which all significant inputs are observable, either directly or indirectly, and corroborated by market data.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:8.7%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 3:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.62%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:87.68%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Prices or valuations that require inputs that are both significant to the fair value measurement and unobservable.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following table sets forth, by level within the fair value hierarchy, financial assets and liabilities that are accounted for at fair value on a recurring basis as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="41%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:41.0%;">

	Total assets
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-21',FILE='C:\JMS\C902056\15-23428-1\TASK7801000\23428-1-FR.HTM',USER='C902056',CD='FEB 24 23:42 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A15-23428_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sale of Domain Name
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On May&nbsp;1, 2014, we entered into an agreement with one of our vendors, acquiring the rights to distribute certain of their software products, which are to be combined with certain of our own products, in exchange for a domain name owned by the Company.&#160; The term of the agreement extends through December&nbsp;31, 2018, and includes a one-year renewal option for the larger of 1% of the maintenance revenue of certain of the Company&#146;s products, or $450,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Market data to determine the fair value of the domain name was not readily available and therefore we used the more clearly evident fair value of the acquired distribution rights to determine the fair value of the agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	To estimate the fair value of the distribution rights, we developed our own assumptions related to the domain name&#146;s future financial performance and projected maintenance revenue of certain of its products.&#160; We developed various scenarios (base case, downside case, and upside case) and evaluated each case according to the probability of occurrence.&#160; Expected cash flows were determined using the probability weighted average of possible outcomes we expect to occur.&#160; The fair value of the acquired distribution rights was determined to be $0.6 million and was based on the present value of these projected scenarios.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As the domain name had zero book value as of the date of sale, we recorded a gain on the sale of $0.6 million.&#160; The acquired distribution right has been recorded in other assets on the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheet.&#160; Given the significant unobservable inputs to the calculation, the other asset recognized for the distribution rights falls within Level 3 of the ASC 820 hierarchy, as defined above.&#160; The other asset is expensed to cost of goods sold ratably over the term of the agreement, and assessed for impairment based on changes in facts and circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .65IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.65IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 13.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Contractual Obligations, Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Office Lease
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On July&nbsp;3, 2014, we entered into an Office Lease Agreement (the &#147;San Francisco Lease&#148;) to lease approximately 6,000 rentable square feet of an office building located in San Francisco, California.&#160; The office building is the new location of our San Francisco office.&#160; The San Francisco Lease commenced on January&nbsp;1, 2015 and expires in January&nbsp;2020.&#160; The total annual rent under the San Francisco Lease ranges from approximately $295,000 for the first year to approximately $332,000 for the final year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;31, 2015, we amended our Office Lease Agreement (the &#147;Pasadena Lease&#148;) dated July&nbsp;26, 2012 to expand our headquarters by approximately 3,600 rentable square feet.&#160; The amendment commences on June&nbsp;1, 2016 and the Pasadena Lease expires on May&nbsp;31, 2024.&#160; Total annual rent under the Pasadena Lease ranges from approximately $2.5 million for the first year to approximately $3.4 million for the final year of the lease.&#160; The expansion increases the annual base rent by a range of approximately $110,000 for the first year to approximately $140,000 for the final year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Effective July&nbsp;7, 2015, we entered into a renewal of our Office Lease Agreement (the &#147;UK Lease&#148;) to lease approximately 8,000 rentable square feet of an office building located in Slough, United Kingdom, which is primarily used as a training center.&#160; The UK Lease commences on January&nbsp;9, 2016 and expires on January&nbsp;8, 2021, with an option to exit the lease on January&nbsp;9, 2019.&#160; The total annual rent under the UK Lease is approximately $267,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Data Center Lease
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Effective April&nbsp;1, 2014, we entered into a Colocation Lease Agreement (the &#147;Colocation Lease&#148;) to rent space in a building located in Chandler, Arizona.&#160; The Colocation Lease expires on June&nbsp;30, 2018.&#160; The Colocation Lease serves as our new data center, replacing our former San Francisco location obtained in the Case Central acquisition.&#160; Rent is based on power allocation and ranges from approximately $236,000 for the first year to approximately $265,000 for the final year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Third-party Software Licenses
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company entered into a $1.5 million third-party software license agreement authorizing the Company to integrate software as a component of its products through March&nbsp;2018.&#160; The agreement also provides for maintenance and support over a three-year period, which may be renewed by the Company at the expiration of the three-year period ending March&nbsp;2018.&#160; The $1.5 million is payable in three annual installments of $492,000, with the final installment being paid in November&nbsp;2016.&#160; The license, maintenance and remaining liability have been recorded on the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	22
<A NAME="A15-23428_110K_HTM_PB_22_150302_7906">
</A>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-22',FILE='C:\JMS\C902056\15-23428-1\TASK7801000\23428-1-FR.HTM',USER='C902056',CD='FEB 24 23:42 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A15-23428_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Letter of Credit
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 we had a $1.2 million letter of credit outstanding against our Senior Secured Revolving Line of Credit with a bank related to the Lease of our Corporate headquarters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Legal Matters
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On May&nbsp;20, 2011, MyKey Technology Inc. (&#147;MyKey&#148;) filed a complaint against us and certain other parties for patent infringement in the United States District Court for the District of Delaware.&#160; With respect to the Company, the complaint alleged that certain of our data acquisition forensic hardware products that we acquired as a result of our acquisition of certain assets of Tableau, LLC (&#147;Tableau&#148;) infringe three of MyKey&#146;s patents relating to write blocking, duplication and data removal technologies, respectively.&#160; The complaint sought a declaration of infringement, a finding of willful infringement, compensatory damages, treble damages, injunctive relief, interest, expenses, costs and attorneys&#146; fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On July&nbsp;22, 2011, MyKey also filed a complaint with the United States International Trade Commission (the &#147;ITC&#148;), alleging infringement by the Company and certain other parties of the three patents discussed in the preceding paragraph and requesting that the ITC commence an investigation pursuant to Section&nbsp;337 of the Tariff Act of 1930.&#160; The complaint sought injunctive relief barring the Company from the importation of products that allegedly infringed the three patents of MyKey.&#160; On August&nbsp;24, 2011, the ITC commenced an investigation of the Company and certain other parties related to the complaint by MyKey.&#160; On August&nbsp;31, 2011 the proceeding in the District Court was stayed pending the resolution of the ITC matter.&#160; On August&nbsp;1, 2012, MyKey amended its ITC complaint to remove allegations that its duplication patent had been infringed by the Company and to reduce the number of claims it alleged the Company had infringed related to MyKey&#146;s data removal patent.&#160; In August&nbsp;2012, the parties completed a trial on the remaining patent claims at issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;28, 2012, the ITC released a final determination and Order holding that no violation of Section&nbsp;337 of the Tariff Act of 1930 occurred as a result of the Company&#146;s importation into the United States and sale of the products at issue.&#160; This Order effectively ended the ITC proceeding in the Company&#146;s favor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;20, 2013, the U.S. District Court of Delaware lifted the stay of the proceedings in the MyKey matter.&#160; Effective April&nbsp;8, 2013, the parties stipulated to a transfer of the matter to the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California. &#160;On April&nbsp;16, 2013, the Company filed its Answer and Counterclaim.&#160; MyKey filed a petition to consolidate a number of related cases, including the case against the Company in the Central District of California, into a Multi-District Litigation (&#147;MDL&#148;) proceeding.&#160; On August&nbsp;16, 2013, the MDL panel approved the petition and assigned the MDL consolidated cases to the judge who is also presiding over the individual case against the Company.&#160; The MDL case will dispose of certain issues common to the consolidated cases, such as the validity of patents being asserted against the joint defendants.&#160; On May&nbsp;23, 2014, the parties completed a Markman hearing related to claim construction of the patents at issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;26, 2014, MyKey also filed a complaint against the United States of America alleging that the United States had infringed U.S. Patents No.&nbsp;6,813,682, 7,159,086 and 7,228,379 by or through its acceptance, receipt and/or use of write blocker products, data duplication products and data removal products. &#160;The complaint alleges that such products were supplied to the government by the Company and certain of its co-defendants in the MDL proceeding.&#160; No damages amount is stated in the complaint.&#160; The government could assert a claim for indemnification against the Company but has not done so yet.&#160; Although a financial loss is reasonably possible, the Company is unable to estimate the range of potential loss at this time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October&nbsp;16, 2014, MyKey filed a Notice of Status on Claim Construction Issues in the MDL action in which it acknowledged that MyKey will not be able to prove that the Company&#146;s data duplication products infringed U.S. Patent 7,159,086.&#160; In the same filing, MyKey acknowledged that certain claims of United States Patent 6,813,682 are invalid and therefore cannot be infringed by any product. On July&nbsp;8, 2015, the judge in the Central District Court of California denied the motions of the Company and other defendants for summary judgment on the validity of the patents remaining in the case. This matter is ongoing, and we anticipate it will go to trial in 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We intend to defend the remaining MyKey matters vigorously and, at this time, are unable to estimate what, if any, liability we may have in connection with these matters.&#160; We are unable to estimate a range of reasonably possible financial losses due to various reasons, including, among others, that (1)&nbsp;certain of the proceedings are at an early stage; (2)&nbsp;there is uncertainty as to the outcome of pending appeals, motions, or settlements; (3)&nbsp;there are significant factual issues to be resolved; (4)&nbsp;there are unresolved negotiations with certain indemnitors or indemnitees of the Company, related to the actions; and (5)&nbsp;we have meritorious defenses that we intend to assert.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	From time to time, we may become involved in various other lawsuits and legal proceedings that arise in the ordinary course of business.&#160; Litigation is subject to inherent uncertainties, and an adverse result in these or other matters may arise from time to time that
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	23
<A NAME="A15-23428_110K_HTM_PB_23_150302_3736">
</A>
</P>

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	may harm our business.&#160; We are not currently aware of any such other legal proceedings or claims that are likely to have a material impact on our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Indemnifications
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have agreed to indemnify our directors and executive officers for costs associated with any fees, expenses, judgments, fines and settlement amounts incurred by them in any action or proceeding to which any of them is, or is threatened to be, made a party by reason of his or her services in their role as a director or officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sales Tax Liabilities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s sales and use tax filings are subject to customary audits by authorities in the jurisdictions where it conducts business in the United States, which may result in assessments of additional taxes.&nbsp; In March&nbsp;2011, we determined that additional sales taxes were probable of being assessed by a certain state as a result of the preliminary findings specific to a sales and use tax audit.&nbsp; The assessment including interest is approximately $1.2 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.&nbsp; The estimated incremental sales and use tax liability was based on a similar model that was being used by the state conducting the sales and use tax audit. Should other states where we have not imposed sales and use taxes determine that the sale of our products or services are subject to sales and use taxes, we could incur future assessments, which would require charges to operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Segment Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We apply the guidance in
<I>
	Segment Reporting
</I>
	(ASC 280) based on our internal organization and reporting of revenue and other performance measures.&#160; Our segments are designed to allocate resources internally and provide a framework to determine management responsibility.&#160; Operating segments are defined as components of an enterprise about which discrete financial information is available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker, or decision making group, in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance.&#160; Our chief operating decision maker is our Chief Executive Officer.&#160; We have five operating segments, as summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 42.5PT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Products segment&#151; Includes EnCase, EnCase Endpoint Security, EnCase eDiscovery, EnCase Forensic, EnCase Portable, Premium License Support Program and hardware sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 42.5PT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Subscription segment&#151; Includes subscription services for cloud-based document review and production software.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 42.5PT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Professional services segment&#151; Performs consulting services and implementations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 42.5PT;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Training segment&#151; Provides training classes by which we train our customers to effectively and efficiently use our software products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Currently, we do not separately allocate operating expenses to these segments, nor do we allocate specific assets, with the exception of goodwill, to segments.&#160; Therefore, the segment information reported includes only revenues, cost of revenues and segment profit.&#160; The following tables present the results of operations for each operating segment (in thousands):

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, long-lived assets located in the United States, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization was approximately $13.4 million and $14.4 million, respectively.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, long-lived assets located in foreign countries, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization was approximately $0.1 million and $0.2 million, respectively.&#160; No individual country outside of the United States accounted for more than 10% of our consolidated long-lived assets.&#160; Long-lived assets exclude goodwill and intangibles assets, which are not allocated to specific geographies as it is impracticable to do so.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenues from transactions with the U.S. Government were generated across all reporting segments and were greater than 10% of total revenues.&#160; U.S. Government revenues were $14.7 million, $15.3 million, and $14.7 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unaudited Quarterly Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following tables set forth below are unaudited quarterly data. In the opinion of management, the following unaudited quarterly data has been prepared on the same basis as the audited financial statements and includes all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair presentation of the results of operations for the periods presented.

<EFX_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 16.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Event
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January&nbsp;14, 2016, the Company announced completion of the restructuring of sales, training, channel and product development to accelerate our Company initiatives.&#160; As part of the restructuring, the Company appointed a new vice president that will be focused on the global channel program.&#160; Additionally, the Company has also restructured its direct sales team under a North American leader and an EMEA leader.&#160; Professional services, training and support will be unified as part of its global services organization.&#160; We expect to incur approximately $2.0 million of realignment expense for employee-related costs associated with this restructuring, including $325,000 for the separation of our founder and chief technology officer, during the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:8.88%;">

<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit 10.44
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	SEPARATION AGREEMENT
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	AND GENERAL RELEASE OF ALL CLAIMS
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This Confidential Separation Agreement and General Release of All Claims (&#147;Separation Agreement&#148;) is entered into by and between
<B>
	Shawn McCreight
</B>
	(&#147;Employee&#148;) and
<B>
	Guidance Software,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
	(&#147;Employer&#148; or &#147;Company&#148;).&#160; The term &#147;Party&#148; or &#147;Parties&#148; as used herein shall refer to Employee, Employer or both, as may be appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Last Day of Employment
</U>
</B>
	.&#160; Employee&#146;s last day of employment with Employer is January&nbsp;13, 2016 (&#147;Separation Date&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Consideration
</U>
</B>
	.&#160; In consideration for signing this Separation Agreement and complying with its terms, and provided Employee does not subsequently revoke this Separation Agreement within the allotted time, Employer agrees:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	to pay to Employee THREE HUNDRED AND TWENTY FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($325,000), representing 52 weeks of salary at Employee&#146;s base rate of pay for each year of service, less lawful deductions, within 10 business days after Employer&#146;s receipt of this Separation Agreement signed and dated by Employee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	No Consideration Absent Execution of this Agreement
</U>
</B>
	.&#160; Employee understands and agrees that Employee would not receive the consideration specified in Section&nbsp;2 above, except for Employee&#146;s execution of this Separation Agreement and the fulfillment of the promises contained herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COBRA Benefits
</U>
</B>
	.&#160; In accordance with the Company&#146;s health plans, Employee will be eligible to exercise Employee&#146;s rights to COBRA health insurance coverage for Employee, and, where applicable, Employee&#146;s spouse and eligible dependents, at Employee&#146;s expense (subject to this Section&nbsp;4), upon termination of Employee&#146;s employment.&#160; To the extent Employee elects COBRA continuation coverage, the Company shall continue to pay the portion of Employee&#146;s COBRA premiums for up to a maximum of twelve (12) months (February&nbsp;1, 2016- January&nbsp;31, 2017).&#160; Nothing herein shall be construed as extending or delaying the start date of Employee&#146;s COBRA coverage period. Employee will receive separate communication regarding the COBRA continuation of coverage.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General Release, Claims Not Released and Related Provisions
</U>
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<U STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General Release of Claims
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&#160; Employee, individually and on behalf of Employee&#146;s heirs, executors, administrators, representatives, attorneys, successors and assigns knowingly and voluntarily releases and forever discharges Employer, including its parent corporation, affiliates, subsidiaries, divisions, predecessors, insurers, successors and assigns, and their current and former employees, attorneys, officers, directors and agents thereof, both individually and in their business capacities, and their employee benefit plans and programs and the trustees, administrators, fiduciaries and insurers of such plans and programs (collectively, the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;Released Parties&#148;), to the full extent permitted by law, of and from any and all claims, known and unknown, asserted and unasserted, which Employee has or may have against the Released Parties as of the date of execution of this Separation Agreement including, but not limited to, any alleged violation of:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

	&#183;

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

	Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964;

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

</P>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
